note.p: Education: Eton; BA (1816, Exeter College, Oxford); MB (1822); MD (1825)

Career: First Professor of Materia Medica at King's College, London (1834); Inspector of Prisons (1835); Commissioner for the Governor of Pentonville Prison; Factory Commissioner; his recommendation led to the registration of cause of death in England
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1894-1895 vol 57 pp xxiv-xxv signed by G B
